notes: With-skill runs achieve 100% pass rate across all 3 evals — the skill reliably forces exhaustive exploration
Without-skill pass rate is highly variable (25%-87.5%) — the notifications baseline scored high because its assertions were more lenient about 'mentioning' vs 'analyzing'
The 'assumption surfacing' assertion is the most discriminating — it fails in all 3 baselines but passes in all 3 with-skill runs
With-skill runs cost ~3x more tokens and ~7.5x more time, but arrive at different (arguably better) recommendations in all 3 cases
All 3 with-skill runs landed on a different final recommendation than their baseline counterpart (Supabase vs SSE, custom framework vs npm loader, TanStack vs vanilla filter)
Graders consistently noted that 'explored' in the paradigm assertion is too lenient — a brief mention passes where substantive analysis should be required
No assertion checks for prototype artifacts — the with-skill runs built 2-3 prototypes each, which is a major differentiator not captured by current assertions
